title: ICE: type mismatch when copying

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use core::mem::{transmute, ManuallyDrop}; // `&mut "literal"` has a type of `&mut &str`, not `&mut str` const S: &'static mut str = &mut " hello "; const fn trigger() -> [(); unsafe { let s = transmute::<(*const u8, usize), &ManuallyDrop>((S.as_ptr(), 3)); 0 }] { [(); 0] } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.46.0 (04488afe3 2020-08-24) rustc 1.47.0-beta.2 (84b047bf6 2020-08-28) rustc 1.48.0-nightly (5099914a1 2020-09-08) ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/interpret/place.rs:860:13: type mismatch when copying! ```
